definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
enclosed carriage for carrying passengers/motor carriage/car or bus/limousine/CL:部[bu4],輛|辆[liang4]
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall

sentences.english: It was after dark and I was nervous, so when he pulled up I immediately jumped in the car.
sentences.chinese: 天黑了，我很緊張，看到車過來了就跳上去。

sentences.english: At about half the distance to Zunyi, I came across a long line of cars.
sentences.chinese: 大約在去遵義的半道上我碰上了一串車排起了長龍。

sentences.english: And a big number of cars are still sold around the world because of their look.
sentences.chinese: 而世界上很多車依然是在賣外觀。

sentences.english: The car must break down just when we were about to start off.
sentences.chinese: 我們正要出發時偏偏車又壞了。

sentences.english: We stop at Pin Wu for lunch, but Sam and David never come down.
sentences.chinese: 中途，司機在平武停下車喫午飯，鵬和嫣沒有下車。

sentences.english: This would be a valid passing opportunity regardless of whether there was pre-existing overlap.
sentences.chinese: 這時後車有權超越，無論有無預先存在“重疊”。

sentences.english: Though badly damaged by fire, the bus tried to make for its garage.
sentences.chinese: 這輛車雖被大火嚴重燒壞，仍努力開回車庫。

sentences.english: And the first time I saw my cousin Tony's brand new Firebird.
sentences.chinese: 是我第一次看到表哥託尼的嶄新的“火鳥”車。

sentences.english: Just then an old man came and helped me. A few minutes later, he mended the bike well.
sentences.chinese: 這時一個老邁爺走過來幫我，幾分鐘後車修好了。

sentences.english: My advice is to purchase something Japenese.
There are extra trains to the seaside during the summer.
sentences.chinese: 通往海邊的火車在夏季有加車。

sentences.english: What type of medium-sized cars do you have?
sentences.chinese: 中型車你們有哪些車種？

sentences.english: A power line testing vehicle at Su-Ao Station.
sentences.chinese: 唐榮制柴油動力架線測試車，蘇澳站。

sentences.english: The next morning Alen insisted on driving me to the car shop.
sentences.chinese: 第二天一大早，Alen堅持要送我去取車。

sentences.english: Jo Leonard: “Who can resist the sound of the first ice-cream van of the season?”
sentences.chinese: 誰能經得住這個季節裏第一輛冰淇淋車到來的誘惑？

definition: car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
bus/abbr. for 公共汽車|公共汽车[gong1 gong4 qi4 che1]/car belonging to an organization and used by its members (government car, police car, company car etc)/abbr. for 公務用車|公务用车[gong1 wu4 yong4 che1]

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
locomotive/train engine car/scooter (Tw)/(slang) (Tw) hard to get along with/a pain in the ass/damn!/crap!
